</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We may in the future invest in or support third-party studies of these and other indications.&#160; If a proof-of-concept should be established, we would then determine whether to seek strategic alliances or collaboration arrangements or utilize other financial alternatives to fund their further development.&#160; There can be no assurance that we will invest or support studies in these indications, that we will secure the necessary capital, whether through government-sponsored grants or otherwise, that any such efforts will be successful, or that we will be able to conclude any such strategic alliance, collaboration arrangement or secure any financial alternative.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	PROPRIETARY PLATFORM &#8211; KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	SURFACTANT AND AEROSOL TECHNOLOGIES
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	Surfactant Technology
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Pulmonary surfactants are protein and phospholipid compositions that form naturally in the human lung and are critical to survival and normal respiratory function.&#160; They spread in a thin mono-layer to cover the entire surface of the air sacs, or alveoli, of the lungs and the terminal conducting airways that lead to the alveoli.&#160; Surfactants facilitate breathing by continually modifying the surface tension of the fluid that lines the inside of the lungs.&#160; If the lungs have a surfactant deficiency, as frequently occurs in premature infants, or experience surfactant degradation, generally due to disease, lung insult or trauma, the alveoli in the lungs will tend to collapse and will not absorb enough oxygen, resulting in severe respiratory diseases and disorders.&#160; In addition to lowering alveolar surface tension, surfactants contribute in other important ways to respiration including, for example, by lowering the surface tension of the conducting airways and maintaining airflow and airway patency (keeping the airways open and expanded).&#160; Many respiratory disorders are associated with surfactant deficiency or surfactant degradation.&#160; However, surfactant therapy is currently approved by the FDA only to manage RDS in premature infants.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our proprietary KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant technology produces a synthetic surfactant that is structurally similar to human pulmonary surfactant and contains a proprietary synthetic peptide, KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	(sinapultide), a 21-amino acid peptide that is designed to imitate the essential attributes of the human surfactant protein B (SP-B), one of four known surfactant proteins and the most important for proper functioning of the respiratory system.&#160; Our synthetic surfactant is manufactured to rigorous specifications, with minimal lot-to-lot variability, is currently approved by the FDA in liquid instillate form, and is being developed in lyophilized (freeze-dried) and aerosolized forms.&#160; We hold an exclusive worldwide license and sublicense to this technology, which was invented at The Scripps Research Institute and exclusively licensed to Johnson &amp; Johnson, Inc. (J&amp;J) and further developed by an affiliate of (J&amp;J).
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We previously demonstrated in preclinical studies that our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant may possess certain beneficial properties, including modulation of the inflammatory process, antimicrobial properties and non-immunogenicity.&#160; (Wolfson, M.R., Wu, J., Hubert, T.L., Gregory, T.J., Mazela, J., &amp; Shaffer, T.H. (2012), &#8220;Lucinactant attenuates pulmonary inflammatory response, preserves lung structure, and improves physiologic outcomes in a preterm lamb model of RDS.&#8221;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Pediatr Res
</FONT>
	, 72(4), 375-383; Black C, Leon C, Pluim J. Bactericidal properties of the novel, peptide-containing surfactant - Surfaxin&#174;. Pediatric Academic Societies, Honolulu, HI, May, 2008.&#160; E&#8209;PAS2008:633756.11; and Clayton RG, Cochrane CG, Gregory TJ. Surfaxin&#174; (lucinactant) does not induce an immune response in a standardized preclinical model. Pediatric Academic Societies, Honolulu, HI, May, 2008.&#160; E&#8209;PAS2008:633756.12.)&#160; We believe these properties may be important attributes as we seek to develop our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant technology pipeline potentially to address a broad range of respiratory conditions that represent significant unmet medical needs.&#160; However, the clinical relevance of such attributes has not been adequately established and, accordingly, warrants further study.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<U>
	KL
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<U>
	4
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<U>
	Surfactant Dosage Forms
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Surfactants currently marketed in the U.S. are liquid instillate and must be stored in refrigerated conditions, warmed prior to use, and administered using endotracheal intubation and mechanical ventilation.&#160; Our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant can be lyophilized (freeze-dried) and reconstituted to a liquid just prior to administration.&#160; We have demonstrated in laboratory experiments that our lyophilized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant retains many of the key attributes and characteristics of our liquid instillate.&#160; We believe that it may provide additional benefits in a clinical setting, including potentially:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="315C7FAD2A9745F7BFE1058B07AECED5" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	improved ease of use for healthcare practitioners, including potential elimination of the drug warming process allowing for shortened preparation time; and potential reduction of continuous cold chain storage and refrigeration requirements;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="3F5FFEA5FA6B4F90B2F3B70CD727AEEB" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	potential for extended shelf life; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="659C9518B8274D8CBD29F1C33F83B398" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	relatively lower viscosity than that of a liquid instillate, which may aid and/or improve the distribution of KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant throughout the lung and potentially may reduce the frequency of transient peri-dosing events typically observed during administration of surfactants.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	8
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage16"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10KA_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We have demonstrated that we can aerosolize both the liquid and lyophilized dosage forms of our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant and that our aerosolized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant product candidate has the following important characteristics:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="2DE4B07DD2E64E8E842A0F65FC5AC1A6" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	full retention of the surface-tension lowering properties of a functioning surfactant necessary to restore lung function and maintain patency of the conducting airways;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="218AD09D88C64E1FAF6165437A0B24BF" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	full retention of the surfactant composition upon aerosolization; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="60CB44FC22B946D6AC84285964758EEF" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	drug particle size believed to be suitable for deposition into the lung.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We are using lyophilized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant to develop aerosolized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant in our AEROSURF development program to treat RDS in premature infants.&#160; Thereafter, we potentially will be able to address a range of indications in neonatal, pediatric and adult critical care patient populations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	The Safety and Efficacy Profile of SURFAXIN for the Prevention of RDS in Premature Infants at High Risk for RDS
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our new drug application (NDA) for SURFAXIN was supported by a phase 3 pivotal trial (SELECT) to evaluate the safety and efficacy of SURFAXIN for the prevention of RDS in premature infants.&#160; Co-primary endpoints were the incidence of RDS at 24 hours and RDS-related mortality at 14 days.&#160; The primary comparator was Exosurf
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	(colfosceril palmitate) with the intent of demonstrating superiority.&#160; SURFAXIN demonstrated a statistically significant improvement in both RDS at 24 hours and RDS-related mortality through day 14.&#160; Survanta
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	(beractant) served as an additional active comparator.&#160; SURFAXIN demonstrated a statistically significant reduction in RDS-related mortality through day 14 versus Survanta.&#160; We also conducted a multicenter, double-blind, active-controlled, phase 3 clinical trial (STAR) which was designed as a non-inferiority trial comparing SURFAXIN to Curosurf
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	(poractant alfa), a surfactant derived from pig lung, and was used to support the safety of SURFAXIN.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	The SELECT and STAR trials, as well as a pooled phase 3 analysis, have been presented at several international medical meetings and the results from the two studies were published in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Pediatrics
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	, the Official Journal of the American Academy of Pediatrics and a premier medical journal for pediatric healthcare practitioners.&#160; Post-hoc analysis of data from our SELECT and STAR phase 3 clinical trials
</FONT>
	indicates that
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	premature infants with RDS who were extubated after treatment with surfactant and who later required reintubation had a significantly higher rate of mortality than those infants who did not require reintubation.&#160; The data also indicate that premature infants treated with SURFAXIN may require less reintubation than currently approved animal-derived surfactants.&#160; Moreover, pharmacoeconomic analysis suggests that lower reintubation rates may result in significant hospital cost savings associated with reduction in time spent on mechanical ventilation and reduced rates of bronchopulmonary dysplasia (BPD), air leak, sepsis, necrotizing enterocolitis (NEC), or intraventricular hemorrhage (IVH).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	SURFAXIN was approved by the FDA in 2012.&#160; In the second quarter of 2015, we decided to cease our commercial and manufacturing activities for SURFAXIN and focus our capital resources on advancing the AEROSURF clinical development program and our aerosolized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant pipeline.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our Aerosolization Delivery Technologies
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Aerosol Delivery System (ADS)
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We have worldwide exclusive rights to our ADS, which consists of a capillary aerosol generator and related components, for use with pulmonary surfactants (alone or in combination with any other pharmaceutical compound(s)) for all respiratory diseases and conditions.&#160; In addition, we hold in the U.S. exclusive rights to this technology for use with non-surfactant drugs to treat certain other pediatric and adult respiratory indications in hospitals and other health care institutions.&#160; Our ADS is protected by a portfolio of patents covering the core components of the system.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	9
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage17"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10KA_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our proprietary ADS is designed to aerosolize our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant.&#160; An aerosol is created by pumping our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant through a heated capillary, after which the aerosol cools and slows in velocity, yielding a dense aerosol with a defined particle size suitable for respiration.&#160; In studies conducted with our initial capillary aerosol generator and our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant, we generated aerosolized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant at consistent and reproducible volumes that could support delivery of therapeutic doses in reasonable periods of time.&#160; In our AEROSURF phase 2a clinical program, we assessed physiological data suggesting that AEROSURF may be delivering surfactant into the lung (where it needs to act) and reducing the incidence of nCPAP failure.&#160; We believe that our ADS is capable of delivering our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant to the lung of premature infants with RDS without having to resort to invasive intubation and mechanical ventilation, procedures that are currently required to administer surfactants.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="8A3E8FA978D04A3396248295FE66F6C3" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 1%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV>
	AFECTAIR
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#174;
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Aerosol-Conducting Airway Connector
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We also developed AFECTAIR, a novel disposable aerosol-conducting airway connector for infants that is intended to simplify the delivery of aerosolized medications (including our aerosolized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant) and other inhaled therapies to critical-care infants requiring ventilatory support.&#160; This device introduces aerosolized medications directly at the patient interface and minimizes the number of connections in the ventilator circuit.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	In vitro
</FONT>
	studies have demonstrated that this connector improves the delivery of inhaled therapies to infants requiring ventilatory support. We therefore believe that using our AFECTAIR device with our ADS will improve the delivery of our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant to premature infants.&#160; Although we initially implemented a plan in 2013 to separately market AFECTAIR, we later concluded that it may provide a potential competitive advantage and decided to reserve AFECTAIR for use with our ADS in our AEROSURF development program.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	BUSINESS OPERATIONS
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Research and Development
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our research and development activities are focused on developing our proprietary KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant, ADS, and aerosol delivery technologies into a series of KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant pipeline programs that potentially could support a significant respiratory critical care franchise.&#160; We are initially focused on the management of RDS in premature infants.&#160; We continually reassess our research and development priorities in light of a number of factors, including the results obtained in our clinical trials, preclinical research and related activities, advances in technology and progress in our device development programs, and relationship of a project to our near-term objectives; our cash flow requirements, financial liquidity and ability to secure necessary capital; and the potential for development partnerships, collaboration agreements and other strategic transactions.&#160; As part of our assessments, we expect to modify and adapt our research and development plans from time to time and anticipate that we will continue to do so in the future.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our research and development resources are focused in the near term primarily on our AEROSURF development program to address RDS.&#160; We are presently engaged in a phase 2 clinical programs and have initiated our phase 2b clinical trial.&#160; Battelle assisted us in the development of a phase 2 clinic-ready ADS and has manufactured and will continue to manufacture a supply of ADS to support our preclinical activities and our phase 2 clinical program.&#160; We also are working with Battelle under a collaboration agreement to develop a phase 3 clinic-ready ADS to support additional research and development activities, our phase 3 clinical program and potential commercial supply.&#160; We are also working with Patheon to manufacture a supply of lyophilized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant to support our phase 2 activities and conduct further manufacturing development work for the planned phase 3 clinical trial.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In markets outside the U.S., for AEROSURF, we plan to seek regulatory advice and discuss with international regulatory authorities a potential AEROSURF development plan to advance AEROSURF in selected major markets around the world.&#160; We also would invest in research and development activities to support a significant strategic alliance focused on the EU and/or other selected markets outside the U.S. for the development and, if approved, commercial introduction of AEROSURF.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	To support our research and development activities, we have:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="E6C382398D5F488C898577896AE0F4F5" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	physicians and scientists on staff and available under consulting arrangements who have expertise in pediatric and pulmonary medicine and extensive contacts in the neonatal medical community;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="9B3E93CE67DB4EE087814442777B0FB0" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	expertise in the design and execution of preclinical experiments and studies to support drug development.&#160; We conduct certain development-related experiments and bench studies in-house and also engage professional research laboratories and collaborate with academic scientific centers to conduct animal studies and experiments requiring specialized equipment and expertise;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">

<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">

<TABLE ID="0EAE17DA3505468BBF3B6F83536A5928" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	expertise in the design, development and management of clinical trials.&#160; We have our own scientific, medical, biostatistics, and trial and data management capabilities.&#160; For the initial phase of the AEROSURF program, we have managed our clinical trial data, supported by third-party technology systems and independent consultants, and monitored all clinical activities using our clinical operations capabilities.&#160; We rely on scientific advisory committees and other medical and consulting experts to assist in the design and monitoring of clinical trials.&#160; We also have retained contract research organizations (CROs) to support our ongoing multi-center AEROSURF trials, including in the U.S., EU, Latin America and Canada;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="129A937E09C5408B9F1C44EFE7E2BCD8" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="4304FC778497429D96601FBFB12A887A" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>

</TD>

	engineering expertise to support development of our ADS and aerosol delivery technologies.&#160; In addition to our collaboration with Battelle, which has significant expertise in developing and integrating aerosol device technologies, we have our own engineering team that is focused on further optimizing our ADS;
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="1D48C4D588B34AD681B973C608D7451B" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	quality operations capabilities to assure compliance of our drug and device development activities with applicable regulations;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="1BCA3FB29C224D4CB9E23C1006230399" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	we rely on CMOs to produce our lyophilized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant, APIs and other materials for our drug product.&#160; We plan to rely on third-party manufacturers to manufacture and assemble our ADS and related components; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="DB0E3D7F60B64624A2729BA4AD6D8AB3" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	our own analytical testing laboratory and research and medical device development laboratory.&#160; We also rely on a number of third-party analytical and testing laboratories to support our research activities and provide certain laboratory services in support of our manufacturing activities.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	Research and development costs are charged to operations as incurred.&#160; During the years ended December 31, 2015, and&#160; December 31, 2014, we invested
</FONT>
	approximately $28.9 million and 26.7 million, respectively, for research and development expense, which includes
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	(i) product development and manufacturing, (ii) medical and regulatory operations, and (iii) direct preclinical and clinical programs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Manufacturing and Distribution
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We use third parties for the manufacture of our lyophilized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant, ADS and related components, AFECTAIR aerosol-conducting airway connector and related components, certain analytical and laboratory services in support of our manufacturing activities, clinical supply labeling, packaging warehousing and distribution.&#160; To support our manufacturing operations, we maintain our own analytical and technical support laboratory at our headquarters in Warrington, Pennsylvania (Warrington Laboratory).
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<U>
	KL
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<U>
	4
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<U>
	Surfactant
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We believe that our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant product is manufactured in compliance with current good manufacturing practices (cGMP) established by the FDA and other international regulatory authorities, as applicable.&#160; Our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant is a complex drug product comprised of four active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs).&#160; It must be aseptically manufactured as a sterile, liquid suspension that requires ongoing monitoring of drug product stability and conformance to specifications.&#160; We currently rely on single source suppliers under separate product supply agreements for KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	and POPG, two of our APIs, and source the other two APIs from a single source supplier under purchase orders that we issue from time to time.&#160; To mitigate our risk, we plan to qualify secondary suppliers for our APIs over the next several years.&#160; Our risk of losing a source of supply is currently somewhat mitigated by our decision to enlarge our safety stock of all APIs.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We manufacture our lyophilized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant at Patheon under a development agreement that expires October 24, 2016.&#160; We completed development work for the technology transfer of our lyophilized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant manufacturing process to Patheon in 2013.&#160; We have since manufactured a sufficient clinical supply of KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant to support our phase 2 clinical program and other development activities.&#160; During the fourth quarter of 2014, we began a technology transfer of our lyophilized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant manufacturing process to another facility at Patheon, where we expect to manufacture our lyophilized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant for use in our AEROSURF phase 3 clinical program.&#160; Under our arrangement with Patheon, we provide the APIs and Patheon purchases excipients and other materials required to manufacture our lyophilized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	11
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage19"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10KA_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In our Warrington Laboratory, we conduct certain analytical development and quality control activities, including release testing of all APIs and release and stability testing of our lyophilized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant clinical drug product.&#160; Our Warrington Laboratory also provides analytical testing and quality system support for our lyophilized and aerosolized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant dosage forms, our research to identify and protect our intellectual property, including studying other potential formulations of our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant and other potential KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant product candidates.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We also work with a number of third-party institutions and laboratories that perform various studies as well as quality control release and stability testing and other activities related to our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant development and manufacturing activities.&#160; At the present time, several of these laboratories are single-source providers.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We previously manufactured our commercial supply of SURFAXIN, our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant in liquid instillate form, at our manufacturing operations located in a leased facility in Totowa New Jersey (Totowa Facility).&#160; In connection with our decision to cease commercialization activities for SURFAXIN, we allowed our lease for this facility to expire in June 2015.&#160; Our Totowa facility consisted of pharmaceutical manufacturing space that was designed for the manufacture and filling of sterile liquid pharmaceuticals in compliance with cGMP.&#160; To support our manufacturing activities, we also operated a microbiology laboratory at our Totowa Facility.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Aerosol Delivery System (ADS)
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	AEROSURF is an investigational combination drug/device product that produces aerosolized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant by combining our lyophilized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant with our aerosol delivery technologies.&#160; We are developing and, if approved, plan to commercialize AEROSURF in the U.S. for the treatment of premature infants with RDS.&#160; We believe that in the future our aerosolized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant may be used to address a broad range of serious respiratory conditions in the NICU as well as in children and adults in the PICU and ICU.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The ADS includes a durable, reusable aerosol control unit and a disposable AEROSURF delivery pack (ADP).&#160; The ADP includes the critical drug product-contact components that are either cleaned or manufactured in an environmentally-controlled, clean area. The control unit and ADPs are assembled and packaged in a clean area.&#160; Each of the ADPs is tested for conformance to designated product specifications during assembly and each of the assembled control units must meet quality control standards prior to release and conform to designated product specifications.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	Beginning in 2012, Battelle assisted us in a multi-phase development program focused on design and testing of clinic-ready ADS for use in our AEROSURF phase 2 clinical trials, and manufactured a sufficient number of ADSs for the phase 2a clinical trial
</FONT>
	in premature infants 29 to 34 week gestational age.&#160; Battelle also agreed to manufacture and assemble a sufficient supply of control units, ADPs
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	and related components
</FONT>
	to support our ongoing phase 2a clinical trial in premature infants 26 to 28 week gestational age, our phase 2b clinical trial in premature infants 26 to 32 week gestational age and development activities.&#160; We expect to arrange for additional control units, ADPs
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	and related components from Battelle, as needed
</FONT>
	.&#160; For our planned phase 3 clinical program, we and Battelle are collaborating to further develop the phase 2 ADS.&#160; Under our Collaboration Agreement, we and Battelle have agreed to negotiate in good faith for the manufacture of phase 3 control units, ADPs and related components.&#160; We are also assessing other potential partners to assure continued availability of ADS for our clinical and development activities through our phase 3 clinical program, and, if approved, initial commercial distribution.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	See,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	&#8220;&#8211; Business Operations &#8211; Strategic Alliances and Collaboration Arrangements &#8211; Battelle Collaboration Agreement.&#8221;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our AFECTAIR aerosol-conducting airway connector has been manufactured by Lacey Manufacturing Company, a division of Precision Products, LLC (Lacey), which also provided labeling and packaging services.&#160; We hold sufficient quantities of this device to support our AEROSURF phase 2b clinical trial.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Distribution
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We currently receive labeling, packaging and distribution services to support our AEROSURF clinical activities in the U.S., European Union and Latin America from Almac&#160;Group Limited&#160;under an agreement that expires October 15, 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	12
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage20"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10KA_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We received warehousing, distribution and related services for SURFAXIN from ASD Specialty Healthcare Inc. (ASD) and Integrated Commercialization Solutions, Inc. (ICS), affiliates of AmerisourceBergen Specialty Group.&#160; ICS provided third-party logistics and assisted us with inventory tracking, customer service, order management, distribution, returned goods, contract and accounts receivable management, certain financial management services and other similar services for SURFAXIN and AFECTAIR.&#160; ASD acted as our exclusive specialty distributor for SURFAXIN in the U.S. and provided related services.&#160; Following the cessation of commercial activities for SURFAXIN, we terminated the arrangement with ASD.&#160; ICS continues to provide limited inventory services for AFECTAIR in support of our clinical activities under an agreement that will expire in October 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our collaboration with Laboratorios del Dr. Esteve, S.A. (Esteve) provides that Esteve has responsibility for distribution of specified KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant products in Andorra, Greece, Italy, Portugal and Spain.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	See,
</FONT>
	&#8220;&#8211; Strategic Alliances and Collaboration Arrangements &#8211; Laboratorios del Dr. Esteve, S.A.&#8221;&#160; In other parts of the world, we expect to contract for third-party distribution services prior to commercializing in those regions.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Strategic Alliances and Collaboration Arrangements
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Battelle Collaboration Agreement
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	On October 10, 2014, we entered into the Collaboration Agreement with Battelle providing for the further development of our ADS for potential use in our planned phase 3 clinical program for AEROSURF for the treatment of RDS in premature infants and, if AEROSURF is approved for commercial sale by the FDA or other regulatory authority, initial commercial supply.&#160; In August 2015, we agreed to amend the Collaboration Agreement to adjust the anticipated Project Plan Cost (as defined in the Agreement) and change the date for completion of Stage 3 (&#8220;Milestone Date&#8221;) as defined in the Collaboration Agreement from May 31, 2016 to July 15, 2016.&#160; As of December 31, 2015, if this development project is successfully completed, we expect to fund development activities of approximately $6.6 million through 2016, subject to certain rights of termination outlined in the Collaboration Agreement.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Pursuant to the Collaboration Agreement, we and Battelle (i) have defined the requirements of the phase 3 ADS and agreed upon a detailed project plan for the next two stages of the project (Stage 1), (ii) are developing the ADS in accordance with the project plan (Stage 2), and (iii) plan to complete all required testing, verification and documentation to be in a position to manufacture a sufficient supply of ADSs (Stage 3) to support our phase 3 clinical program.&#160; Upon completion of the three-stage project plan, we and Battelle intend to negotiate in good faith potentially to enter into an agreement for the manufacture of a sufficient number of ADS to support the planned AEROSURF phase 3 clinical program, and, if AEROSURF is approved, to negotiate in good faith potentially to enter into a supply agreement providing for an initial commercial supply of ADSs.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	A Steering Committee, comprised of an equal number of members appointed by each party, oversee the work of the project.&#160; The foregoing notwithstanding, we will retain final decision-making authority on all matters related to the design, registration, manufacture, packaging, marketing, distribution and sale of ADSs.&#160; We and Battelle shared equally in the costs of Stage 1 activities.&#160; Following completion of Stage 1, we and Battelle agreed on a detailed project plan, including projected costs, for Stages 2 and 3.&#160; The parties will share equally in the costs of the project plan for Stages 2 and 3 as set forth in the project plan.&#160; Battelle will bear the entire cost of any cost overruns associated with execution of the project plan and we will bear the entire cost of any increase in the agreed upon project plan costs resulting from changes in the scope of the product requirements as agreed in Stage 1 and set forth in the project plan.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In connection with the Collaboration Agreement, we issued to Battelle two warrants to purchase shares of our common stock, each having an exercise price of&#160; $70 per share and a term of 10 years, subject to earlier termination under certain circumstances set forth therein, including (i) a warrant to purchase up to 71,429 shares of our common stock, exercisable upon successful completion by Battelle of the Stage 3 activities (Initial Warrant), and (ii) a warrant to purchase up to 35,714 shares of our common stock (Additional Warrant; and together with the Initial Warrant, the Battelle Warrants), exercisable if and only if Battelle successfully completes the Stage 3 activities no later than July 15, 2016 (Milestone Date), which date may be adjusted as provided in the Collaboration Agreement.&#160; We and Battelle have agreed to execute a registration rights agreement providing for the registration of the resale of shares underlying the Battelle Warrants.&#160; The Battelle Warrants may be exercised for cash only, except that, in the event a registration statement is not effective at the time of exercise and if an exemption from registration is otherwise available at that time, the Battelle Warrants may be exercised on a cashless basis.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	13
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage21"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10KA_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In addition, if Battelle successfully completes the Stage 3 activities, we have agreed to pay Battelle royalties equal to a low single-digit percentage of the worldwide net sales and license royalties on sales of AEROSURF for the treatment of RDS in premature infants, up to an aggregate limit of $25 million.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The term of the Collaboration Agreement will end at the time we fulfill our payment obligations to Battelle, unless sooner terminated by a party as provided in the Collaboration Agreement, including for a &#8220;failure of purpose&#8221; (as defined therein) or a material breach by either party.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Laboratorios del Dr. Esteve, S.A.
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	We have a strategic alliance with Laboratorios del Dr. Esteve, S.A. (Esteve) for the development, marketing and sales of a broad portfolio of potential KL
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	surfactant products in Andorra, Greece, Italy, Portugal, and Spain (collectively, the territory).&#160; Antonio Esteve, Ph.D., a principal of Esteve, served as a member of our Board of Directors from May 2002 until January 2013.&#160; Under the alliance, Esteve will pay us a transfer price on sales of our KL
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	surfactant products.&#160; We will be responsible for the manufacture and supply of all of the covered products and Esteve will be responsible for all sales and marketing in the territory.&#160; Esteve is obligated to make stipulated cash payments to us upon our achievement of certain milestones, primarily upon receipt of marketing regulatory approvals for the covered products.&#160; In addition, Esteve has agreed to contribute to phase 3 clinical trials for the covered products by conducting and funding development performed in the territory.&#160; As part of a 2004 restructuring in which Esteve returned certain rights to us in certain territories (Former Esteve Territories), we agreed to pay Esteve 10% of any cash up front and milestone fees (up to a maximum aggregate of $20 million) that we receive in connection with any strategic collaborations for the development and/or commercialization of certain of our KL
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	surfactant products in the Former Esteve Territories.&#160;
</FONT>
	The alliance will terminate as to each covered product, on a country-by-country basis, upon the latest to occur of: the expiration of the last patent claim related to a covered product in such country; the first commercial sale in such country of the first-to-appear generic formulation of the covered product, and the tenth anniversary of the first sale of the covered product in such country.&#160; In addition to customary termination provisions for breach of the agreement by a party, the alliance agreement may be terminated by Esteve on 60 days&#8217; prior written notice, up to the date of receipt of the first marketing regulatory approval, or, on up to six months&#8217; written notice, if the first marketing regulatory approval has issued.&#160; We may terminate the alliance agreement in the event that Esteve acquires a competitive product (as defined in the agreement).
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Potential Alliances and Collaboration Arrangements
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We continue to enter into discussions with entities with a view to enter into strategic alliances, collaboration arrangements and other opportunities to support our AEROSURF development activities and resources and expertise to support the registration and commercialization of&#160;AEROSURF and potentially support the development and, if approved, commercialization of our other&#160;KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant product candidates in markets outside the U.S.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	LICENSING, PATENTS AND OTHER PROPRIETARY RIGHTS AND REGULATORY DESIGNATIONS
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We continue to invest in maintaining and enforcing our potential competitive position through a number of means: (i) by protecting our exclusive rights in our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant, ADS and aerosol-conducting airway connector technologies through patents and patent term restorations, (ii) by seeking regulatory exclusivities, including potential orphan drug and new drug product exclusivities, and (iii) through protecting our trade secrets and proprietary methodologies that support our manufacturing and analytical processes.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">

<A NAME="eolPage22"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Patents and Proprietary Rights
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Johnson &amp; Johnson, Ortho Pharmaceutical Corporation and The Scripps Research Institute
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	Our precision-engineered KL
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	surfactant technology was invented at The Scripps Research Institute (Scripps) and was exclusively licensed to and further developed by J&amp;J.&#160; We have received an exclusive, worldwide license and sublicense from J&amp;J and its wholly-owned subsidiary, Ortho Pharmaceutical Corporation a series of over 30 patents and patent filings (worldwide) which are important, either individually or collectively, to our strategy for commercializing our KL
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	surfactant product candidates.&#160; The license and sublicense give us the exclusive rights to such patents for the life of the patents.&#160;
</FONT>
	Under the license agreement, we are obligated to pay the licensors fees of up to $2.5 million in the aggregate upon our achievement of certain milestones, primarily upon receipt of marketing regulatory approvals for certain designated products.&#160; In addition,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	we have paid $950,000 to date for milestones that have been achieved.&#160;
</FONT>
	In addition, we are required to make royalty payments at different rates, depending upon type of revenue and country, in amounts in the range of a high single-digit percent of net sales (as defined in the agreement) of licensed products sold by us or sublicensees, or, if greater, a percentage of royalty income from sublicensees in the low double digits.&#160; The license agreement provides that the license will expire, on a country-by-country basis, upon the payment of royalties for all licensed products for ten years beginning on the date of the first commercial sale of the first licensed product in such country. Thereafter, royalties shall be paid in respect of a given licensed product until the expiration of the last licensed patent containing a valid claim covering the licensed product in such country. For countries in the EU in which royalties are paid only by virtue of licensed know-how, royalties shall&#160; be payable commencing from the date of first commercial sale of the first licensed product in such country and ending on the earlier of (i) the date on which the licensed know-how becomes public or (ii) the tenth anniversary of the first commercial sale of the first licensed product in any country of the EU.&#160; In addition to customary termination provisions for breach of the agreement by a party, we may terminate the agreement, as to countries other than the U.S. and Western Europe territories (as defined in the agreement), on a country-by-country basis, on six months&#8217; prior written notice; and as to the entire agreement, on 60 days&#8217; prior written notice.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Patents covering our proprietary surfactant technology that have been issued worldwide include composition of matter, formulation, and uses and include the following issued U.S. patents: U.S. Patent No. 5,407,914; U.S. Patent No. 5,952,303; U.S. Patent No. 6,013,619; and U.S. Patent No. 6, 613,764 (along with certain corresponding issued foreign counterparts).&#160; These patents relate to precision-engineered pulmonary surfactants (including SURFAXIN), certain related peptides (amino acid protein-like substances) and compositions, methods of treating respiratory distress syndromes with these surfactants and compositions, and a pulmonary lavage method of treating RDS with these surfactants.&#160; Our licensed patent estate also includes the U.S. and foreign patents that relate to methods of manufacturing SURFAXIN and certain peptides that may be used in the manufacture of SURFAXIN, and other aspects of our precision-engineered surfactant technology.&#160; These patents include U.S. Patent No. 5,741,891; U.S. Patent No. 5,952,303; U.S. Patent No. 6,013,764; U.S. Patent No. 6,120,795; U.S. Patent No. 6,492,490; and U.S. Patent No. 8,217,142 (along with certain corresponding issued foreign counterparts).
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The patent term of U.S. Patent No. 5,407,914 was previously extended until November 17, 2014 and is now expired.&#160; U.S. Patent No. 5,952,303 will expire on March 29, 2017.&#160; U.S. Patent No. 5,741,891 will expire on October 22, 2016.&#160; U.S. Patent No. 6,120,795 will expire on March 4, 2017.&#160; U.S. Patent No. 6,013,764, U.S. Patent No. 6,492,490 and U.S. Patent No. 8,217,142 will expire on June 25, 2017.&#160; U.S. Patent No. 6,013,619 will expire on April 28, 2017.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We also have licensed or optioned for license certain patents and pending patent applications from Scripps that relate to combination therapies of pulmonary surfactant and other drugs, and methods of use.&#160; Some of these patent applications have issued in the U.S. and a number of foreign jurisdictions, including Australia, Canada, Israel, Japan, New Zealand, South Africa, South Korea, and Singapore.&#160; In the U.S., selected compositions of pulmonary surfactants and protease inhibitors and methods of administering these compositions are claimed in the U.S. Patent No. 7,863,241 titled &#8220;Compositions for treatment and prevention of pulmonary conditions&#8221; which issued on January 4, 2011 and will expire on August 21, 2023.
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We have been active in seeking patent protection for our innovations relating to new dosage forms, formulations and methods of manufacturing and delivering synthetic peptide containing pulmonary surfactants.&#160; Our patent activities have focused particularly on improved dosage forms and delivery of aerosolized pulmonary surfactant.
</DIV>

<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In November 2005, we filed U.S. and International patent applications (US 11/274,701 which is now U.S. Patent No. 7,582,312 issued on September 1, 2009 and PCT US/2005/041281, now entered national phase), directed to lyophilized formulations of synthetic peptide containing pulmonary surfactants and methods of manufacture.&#160; U.S. Patent No. 7,582,312 will expire on November 15, 2025.

<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In December 2005, we filed U.S. and International patent applications (US 11/316,308 which is now U.S. Patent No. 8,337,815 issued on December 25, 2012 and PCT US/2005/046862, now entered national phase), directed to synthetic peptide containing pulmonary surfactant formulations having improved viscosity characteristics, aerosolization capacity and storage stability.&#160; U.S. Patent No. 8,337,815 will expire on December 12, 2028.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In January 2006, we filed U.S. and International patent applications (US 11/326,885 which is now U.S. Patent No 7,541,331 issued on June 2, 2009 and PCT/US06/000308, now entered national phase), directed to a surfactant treatment regimen for BPD.&#160; U.S. Patent No 7,541,331 will expire on January 6, 2026.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In September 2007, we filed U.S. and International patent applications (US 11/901,866 which is now U.S. Patent No. 8,221,772 and PCT US/2007/020260, now entered national phase) directed to surfactant compositions and methods of promoting mucus clearance and treating pulmonary disorders such as cystic fibrosis.&#160; U.S. Patent No. 8,221,772 will expire on September 19, 2027.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In March 2013, we filed International patent applications (PCT/US13/34364 and PCT/US13/34464, now entered national phase and commenced expedited examination in U.S. and EU) directed to lyophilized pulmonary surfactant and methods of manufacture.&#160; In this patent family, two U.S. Patents Nos. 8,748,396 and 8,748,397 were issued on June 10, 2014, European patent 2723323B1 issued on September 23, 2015 and another U.S. patent application (US 14/387707) along with multiple foreign counterparts are pending.&#160; U.S. Patents Nos. 8,748,396 and 8,748,397 and European patent 2723323B1will expire on March 28, 2033.
</DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Philip Morris USA Inc. and Philip Morris Products S.A.
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In 2008, to restructure a December 2005 strategic alliance, we entered into an Amended and Restated License Agreement with Philip Morris USA, Inc. (PMUSA) with respect to the U.S. (U.S. License Agreement), and, as PMUSA had assigned its ex-U.S. rights to Philip Morris Products S.A. (PMPSA), we entered into a license agreement with PMPSA with respect to rights outside of the U.S., effective on the same date and on substantially the same terms and conditions as the U.S. License Agreement.&#160; These agreements licensed to us all rights in and to PMUSA and PMPSA proprietary aerosol technology.&#160; In addition to customary termination provisions for breach of the agreements, we may terminate the License Agreements, in whole or in part, upon advance written notice to the licensor.&#160; In addition, either party to each License Agreement may terminate upon a material breach by the other party (subject to a specified cure period).&#160; Our license under each License Agreement, unless terminated earlier, will expire as to each licensed product, on a country-by-country basis, upon the latest to occur of: the date on which the sale of such licensed product ceases to be covered by a valid patent claim in such country; the date a generic form of the product is introduced in such country; or the tenth anniversary of the first commercial sale of such licensed product.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Under the License Agreements, we are obligated to pay royalties at a rate equal to a low single-digit percent of sales of products sold in the Exclusive Field (
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	see,
</FONT>
	&#8220;&#8211; Aerosol Technology Patents and Patent Rights.&#8221;) in the territories.&#160; In connection with exclusive undertakings of PMUSA and PMPSA not to exploit the aerosol technology for all licensed uses, we are obligated to pay royalties on all product sales, including sales of certain aerosol devices that are not based on the licensed aerosol technology; provided, however, that no royalties are payable to the extent that we exercise our right to terminate the license with respect to a specific indication.&#160; We also have been required to pay minimum royalties quarterly beginning in 2014, but are entitled to reduce future quarterly royalties above the quarterly minimums in the amount of the true-up payments we make to satisfy minimum royalties for prior quarters.&#160; Our license rights extend to innovations to the aerosol technology that are made under the License Agreements.&#160; We believe that our AEROSURF aerosolized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant can be developed to potentially address a broad range of serious respiratory conditions.&#160; We are developing AEROSURF to treat premature infants with RDS using the proprietary aerosol technology.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	16
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage24"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10KA_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Aerosol Technology Patents and Patent Rights
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We currently hold exclusive licenses to the aerosol technology, which is the core technology in our ADS.&#160; This technology is based on a capillary aerosol generator and is licensed both in and outside of the U.S. for use with pulmonary surfactants (alone or in combination with any other pharmaceutical compound(s)) for all respiratory diseases and conditions.&#160; In addition, under the U.S. License Agreement, our license to use the aerosol technology includes certain non-surfactant drugs to treat certain designated pediatric and adult respiratory indications in hospitals and other health care institutions.&#160; The aerosol technology patents expire on various dates beginning in May 2016 and ending in 2031, or, in some cases, possibly later.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Aerosol-Conducting Airway Connector Technology Patents and Patent Rights
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In March 2009, we filed International patent application (PCT US/2009/037409, now entered national phase) directed to aerosol-conducting airway connectors and improvements of an aerosol delivery system using AFECTAIR.&#160; The claims of this application are directed to a novel ventilation circuit adaptor (an aerosol-conducting airway connector) and related aerosol circuitry that are intended to increase the efficiency of aerosol delivery to the patient by allowing more efficient delivery of aerosols to the patient, reduce drug compound dilution and wastage and result in more precise aerosol dosing.&#160; In this patent family, U.S. Patent No. 8,701,658 was issued on April 22, 2014, European patent No. 2265309 was issued on December 16, 2015 and several foreign patents have issued during 2011 through 2015.&#160; U.S. Patent No. 8,701,658 will expire on March 17, 2029.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	See,
</FONT>
	&#8220;Item 1A &#8211; Risk Factors &#8211; If we cannot protect our intellectual property, other companies could use our technology in competitive products.&#160; Even if we obtain patents to protect our products, those patents may not be sufficiently broad or they may expire and others could then compete with us;&#8221; &#8220;&#8211; Intellectual property rights of third parties could limit our ability to develop and market our products;&#8221; and &#8220;&#8211; If we cannot meet requirements under our license agreements, we could lose the rights to our products.&#8221;
</DIV>
<DIV>
