</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our post-marketing activities, including promotion, marketing and manufacturing, will be subject to continuing review.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	If we receive marketing authorization in the United States for AEROSURF, our approved labeling will contain, among other things, limitations that affect the manner in which we may promote, market and sell our approved product.&#160;
</FONT>
	Any promotion, marketing and sales efforts will have to be based on the content of our labeling, although certain scientific information that speaks to the benefits of our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant may be provided by our medical affairs representatives in response to unsolicited requests for information.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The FDA and other regulatory agencies actively enforce regulations prohibiting promotion of off-label uses and the promotion of products for which marketing clearance has not been obtained.&#160; If the FDA were to determine that promotional materials for our products, including labeling, training or other marketing or educational activities, constitute promotion of an unapproved use, it could issue to us and our alliance partner a warning or untitled letter or direct our alliance partner to cease using or modify training or promotional materials, or subject us or our alliance partner to serious regulatory enforcement actions.&#160; For example, on March 6, 2015, we received an untitled letter from FDA regarding promotional materials alleged to contain unsubstantiated claims of the superiority of SURFAXIN to animal-derived surfactants and broaden the intended use of SURFAXIN by implying that it is approved for the treatment of RDS in premature infants when it is only approved for the prevention of RDS in premature infants.&#160; We promptly implemented a plan and responded to the concerns raised in the letter within the time period set forth therein.&#160; It is also possible that other federal, state or foreign enforcement authorities could take action if they consider that we or our alliance partners have engaged in activities that constitute promotion of an unapproved use, which could result in significant fines or penalties under other statutory authorities, such as laws prohibiting false claims for reimbursement.&#160; A company that is found to have improperly promoted off-label uses may be subject to significant liability, including civil and administrative remedies as well as criminal sanctions.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We expect to provide our AFECTAIR device with our AEROSURF drug-device product candidate.&#160; If AEROSURF is approved, the FDA may determine that AFECTAIR is no longer a Class I, 510(k)-exempt medical device.&#160; During the development of AEROSURF, we expect to discuss with the FDA the regulatory status of AFECTAIR.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	In addition, we will have to comply with reporting requirements applicable to drug products and medical devices, including the reporting of adverse events and device malfunctions related to our products.&#160; Later discovery of previously unknown problems, including unanticipated adverse events or adverse events of unanticipated severity or frequency, manufacturing problems or failure to comply with regulatory requirements may result in changes to labeling, restrictions on such products or manufacturing processes, withdrawal of the products from the market or regulatory enforcement actions
</FONT>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We expect to face uncertainty over reimbursement and healthcare reform.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In both the U.S. and other countries, sales of our products will depend in part upon the availability of reimbursement from third-party payers, which include governmental health administration authorities, managed care providers and private health insurers.&#160; Government and other healthcare payers increasingly challenge the price and examine the cost effectiveness of medical products and services.&#160; Moreover, the current political environment in the U.S. and abroad may result in the passage of significant legislation that could, among other things, restructure the markets in which we operate and restrict pricing strategies of drug development companies.&#160; If, for example, price restrictions were placed on the distribution of our drugs, we may be forced to curtail development of our pipeline products and this could have a material adverse effect on our business, results of operations and financial condition.&#160; Even if we succeed in commercializing our drug products, uncertainties regarding health care policy, legislation and regulation, as well as private market practices, could affect our ability to sell our products in quantities or at prices that will enable us to achieve profitability.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	To obtain reimbursement from a third-party payer, it must determine that our drug product is a covered benefit under its health plan, which is likely to require a determination that our product is:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="D64154CEDFB14018B7BD8393206A047B" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#8226;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	safe, effective and medically necessary;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="4D36F118B8C8422C877F87654A9A90CF" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>

	appropriate for the specific patient;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="04541D2234FC495D85A83032671369E0" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>

</TD>

	cost-effective; and
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">

</TD>

	neither experimental nor investigational.
</TD>

<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	47
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage55"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10KA_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Obtaining a determination that a product is a covered benefit may be a time-consuming and costly process that could require us to provide supporting scientific, clinical and cost-effectiveness data about our products to each payer.&#160; We may not be able to provide sufficient data to gain coverage.&#160; Even when a payer determines that a product is covered, the payer may impose limitations that preclude payment for some uses that are approved by the FDA or other regulatory authorities.&#160; Cost-containment measures, if implemented to affect the coverage or reimbursement of our products could have a material adverse effect on our ability to market our products profitably.&#160; Moreover, coverage does not imply that any product will be covered in all cases or that reimbursement will be available at a rate that would permit a health care provider to cover its costs of using our product.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Prices in many countries, including many in Europe, are subject to local regulation and certain pharmaceutical products may be subject to price controls in several of the world&#8217;s principal markets, including many countries within the EU.&#160; In the U.S., where pricing levels for our products are substantially established by third-party payers, if payers reduce the amount of reimbursement for a product, it may cause groups or individuals dispensing the product to discontinue administration of the product, to administer lower doses, to substitute lower cost products or to seek additional price-related concessions.&#160; These actions could have a negative effect on our financial results, particularly in cases where our products command a premium price in the marketplace.&#160; The existence of direct and indirect price controls and pressures over our products could materially adversely affect our financial prospects and performance.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	A catastrophic event at our Warrington, Pennsylvania facility or any of the facilities used by our third party-manufacturers would prevent us from producing many of our drug products candidates and/or medical devices.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	All of our facilities are located our headquarters in Warrington, Pennsylvania.&#160; We maintain our analytical testing and device development laboratories in Warrington, Pennsylvania.&#160; We depend upon third-party manufacturers to manufacture our lyophilized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant, our AFECTAIR device and our ADS.&#160; All of these products are or will be manufactured at a single source facility.&#160; If a catastrophic event occurred at our headquarters facility or the facilities of any of our third-party manufacturers, such as a fire, flood or tornado, many of those products could not be produced until the manufacturing portion of such facility was restored and cleared by the FDA.&#160; With respect to our headquarters facility, we maintain a disaster plan to minimize the effects of such a catastrophe, and we have obtained insurance to protect against certain business interruption losses.&#160; However, there can be no assurance that any such coverage will be adequate or that such coverage will continue to remain available on acceptable terms, if at all.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The implementation of the 2010 Health Care Reform Law in the U.S. may adversely affect our business.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act as amended by the Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act, each enacted in March 2010, generally known as the Health Care Reform Law, significantly expands health insurance coverage to uninsured Americans and changes the way health care is financed by both governmental and private payers.&#160; We expect expansion of access to health insurance may increase the demand for products generally, but other provisions of the Health Care Reform Law could affect us adversely.&#160; The changes contemplated by the health care reform law are subject to timelines that extend for several years, and further federal and state proposals for healthcare reform are likely.&#160;&#160; This uncertainty limits our ability to forecast changes that may occur in the future.&#160; However, any changes that lower reimbursements for our products could adversely affect our business and results of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Health Care Reform Law includes provisions, referred to as the federal &#8220;Open Payments&#8221; law (previously referred to as the &#8220;Sunshine Law&#8221;), that establish new reporting and disclosure requirements for pharmaceutical and medical device manufacturers.&#160; Under the law, pharmaceutical and device manufacturers are required to annually report various types of payments and other transfers of value to physicians and teaching hospitals.&#160; A
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	pplicable manufacturers are to report data to the U.S. Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) on an annual basis, and the data are made publicly available via a CMS website.&#160; Inaccurate or incomplete reports may be subject to enforcement, and it is expected that data will be subject to significant public scrutiny.&#160; Like the federal Open Payments law, several states have existing laws that require manufacturers to report transfers of value to select healthcare providers licensed within the state, or even go so far as to
</FONT>
	prohibit certain marketing related activities.&#160; Other states, such as California, Nevada, Massachusetts and Connecticut, require pharmaceutical and/or device companies to implement compliance programs or marketing codes.&#160; In others, it is possible that we will be subject to the state&#8217;s reporting requirements and prohibitions.&#160; Compliance activities with respect to these measures could increase our costs and adversely affect business operations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	48
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage56"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10KA_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Health Care Reform Law contains many provisions designed to generate the revenues necessary to fund the coverage expansions and to reduce costs of Medicare and Medicaid, including imposing a 2.3% excise tax on domestic sales of medical devices by manufacturers and importers beginning in 2013, and a fee on branded prescription drugs that was implemented in 2011, both of which may affect sales of our products.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	In December 2015, legislation was enacted that imposed a two-year moratorium on the medical device excise tax, which means that the tax will not apply to sales during the period from January 1, 2016 through December 31, 2017.&#160; However, we cannot predict the effect that subsequent legislation, if any, may have on the length of the moratorium or on the excise tax itself.&#160;
</FONT>
	At the present time, the effect of this tax on our business is not material.&#160; However, as U.S. net sales are expected to be a significant portion of our worldwide net sales in the coming years, beginning with AEROSURF, this additional tax burden may have a material, negative impact on our results of operations and our cash flows.&#160; The Health Care Reform Law also mandates pharmacy benefit manager transparency regarding rebates, discounts and price concessions with respect to drug benefits under Medicare Part D, and in 2014 with respect to drug benefits offered through qualified health plans offered through state exchanges, which could affect pricing and competition.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Political, economic and regulatory influences are subjecting the healthcare industry to potential fundamental changes that could substantially affect our results of operations.&#160; Government and private sector initiatives to limit the growth of healthcare costs, including price regulation, competitive pricing, coverage and payment policies, comparative effectiveness of therapies, technology assessments and managed-care arrangements, are continuing in many countries where we plan to do business, including the U.S.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Health Care Reform Law establishes the Independent Payment Advisory Board, which will be responsible, beginning in 2014, annually to submit proposals aimed at reducing Medicare cost growth while preserving quality.&#160; These proposals automatically will be implemented unless Congress enacts alternative proposals that achieve the same savings targets.&#160; Further, the legislation calls for a Center for Medicare and Medicaid Innovation that will examine alternative payment methodologies and conduct demonstration programs.&#160; The legislation provides for extensive health insurance reforms, including the elimination of pre-existing condition exclusions and other limitations on coverage, fixed percentages on medical loss ratios, expansion in Medicaid and other programs, employer mandates, individual mandates, creation of state and regional health insurance exchanges, and tax subsidies for individuals to help cover the cost of individual insurance coverage.&#160; The legislation also permits the establishment of accountable care organizations, a new healthcare delivery model.&#160; While the ultimate impact of the legislation on the healthcare industry is unknown, it is likely to be extensive and may result in significant change.&#160; Our failure to adapt to these changes could have a material adverse effect on our business.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Additionally, in the next several years regulations and guidance implementing the Health Care Reform Law, as well as additional healthcare reform proposals, may have a financial impact on our business.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	If we cannot protect our intellectual property, other companies could use our technology in competitive products.&#160; Even if we obtain patents to protect our products, those patents may not be sufficiently broad or they may expire and others could then compete with us.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We seek patent protection for our drug and device products and product candidates to prevent others from commercializing equivalent products in substantially less time and at substantially lower expense.&#160; The pharmaceutical industry places considerable importance on obtaining patent and trade secret protection for new technologies, products and processes.&#160; Our success will depend in part on our ability and that of parties from whom we license technology to successfully obtain patents, defend our patents, protect our trade secrets, and otherwise prevent others from infringing our proprietary rights.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	49
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage57"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10KA_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The patent position of companies relying upon biotechnology is highly uncertain and involves complex legal and factual questions for which important legal principles are unresolved.&#160; To date, the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) has not adopted a consistent policy regarding the breadth of claims that is accorded in biotechnology patents or the degree of protection that these types of patents afford.&#160; As a result, there are risks that we may not secure proprietary rights to products or processes that appear to be patentable.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The parties who licensed technologies to us and we have filed various U.S. and foreign patent applications with respect to the products and technologies under our development, and the USPTO and foreign patent offices have issued patents with respect to our products and technologies.&#160; These patent applications include international applications filed under the Patent Cooperation Treaty.&#160; Our pending patent applications, those we may file in the future or those we may license from third parties may not result in the USPTO or foreign patent office issuing patents.&#160; In addition, if patent rights covering our products are not sufficiently broad, they may not provide us with sufficient proprietary protection or competitive advantages against competitors with similar products and technologies.&#160; Furthermore, even if the USPTO or foreign patent offices were to issue patents to us or our licensors, others may challenge the patents or circumvent the patents, or the patent office or the courts may invalidate the patents.&#160; Thus, any patents we own or license from third parties may not provide us any protection against competitors.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The patents that we hold have a limited life.&#160; We have licensed a series of patents for our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant technology from J&amp;J and its wholly-owned subsidiary Ortho Pharmaceutical Corporation (Ortho Pharmaceutical), which are important, both individually and collectively, to our strategy of commercializing our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant products.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	These patents, which include KL
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	surfactant composition of matter claims, KL
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	peptide method of manufacture claims and relevant European patents, began to expire in November 2009, and will expire on various dates ending in 2017.
</FONT>
	For our aerosolized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant, we hold worldwide exclusive licenses from Philip Morris USA Inc. (PMUSA) and Philip Morris Products S.S. (PMPSA) to the proprietary aerosol technology for use with pulmonary surfactants together or in combination with other products for all respiratory diseases.&#160; Our exclusive license in the U.S. also extends to other (non-surfactant) drugs to treat a wide range of pediatric and adult respiratory indications in hospitals and other health care institutions.&#160; The proprietary aerosol technology patents expire on various dates beginning in May 2016 and ending in 2031, or, in some cases, possibly later.&#160; We have filed, and when possible and appropriate, will file, other patent applications with respect to our products and processes in the U.S. and in foreign countries.&#160; Certain of such patents related to lyophilized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant have issued in the U.S. and Europe and will expire in March 2033.&#160; We may not be able to develop enhanced or additional products or processes that will be patentable under patent law and, if we do enhance or develop additional products that we believe are patentable, additional patents may not be issued to us.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our technology platform consists solely of our proprietary KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant technology, our proprietary aerosol technology, and our novel aerosol-conducting airway connector.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our technology platform is based on the scientific rationale of using our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant technology, our proprietary aerosol technology and our novel patient interface and related componentry to treat life-threatening respiratory disorders and to serve as the foundation for the development of novel respiratory therapies and products.&#160; Our business is dependent upon the successful development and approval of our drug product candidates and our combination drug-device products based on these technologies.&#160; Any material problems with our technology platforms could have a material adverse effect on our business.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Intellectual property rights of third parties could limit our ability to develop and market our products.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our success also depends upon our ability to operate our business without infringing the patents or violating the proprietary rights of others.&#160; In certain cases, the USPTO keeps U.S. patent applications confidential while the applications are pending.&#160; As a result, we cannot determine in advance what inventions third parties may claim in their pending patent applications.&#160; We may need to defend or enforce our patent and license rights or to determine the scope and validity of the proprietary rights of others through legal proceedings, which would be costly, unpredictable and time consuming.&#160; Even in proceedings where the outcome is favorable to us, they would likely divert substantial resources, including management time, from our other activities.&#160; Moreover, any adverse determination could subject us to significant liability or require us to seek licenses that third parties might not grant to us or might only grant at rates that diminish or deplete the profitability of our products.&#160; An adverse determination could also require us to alter our products or processes or cease altogether any product sales or related research and development activities.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	50
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage58"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10KA_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	If we cannot meet requirements under our license agreements, we could lose the rights to our products.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We depend on licensing agreements with third parties to maintain the intellectual property rights to our products under development.&#160; Presently, we have licensed rights from J&amp;J, Ortho Pharmaceutical, PMUSA, PMPSA and The Scripps Institute.&#160; These agreements require us to make payments and satisfy performance obligations to maintain our rights under these licensing agreements.&#160; All of these agreements last either throughout the life of the related patents or for a number of years after the first commercial sale of the relevant product.&#160; In addition, we are responsible for the cost of filing and prosecuting certain patent applications and maintaining certain issued patents licensed to us.&#160; If we do not meet our obligations under our license agreements in a timely manner, we could lose the rights to our proprietary technology.&#160; Finally, we may be required to obtain licenses to patents or other proprietary rights of third parties in connection with the development and use of our products and technologies.&#160; Licenses required under any such patents or proprietary rights might not be made available on terms acceptable to us, if at all.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We rely on agreements containing obligations regarding intellectual property, confidentiality and noncompetition provisions that could be breached and may be difficult to enforce.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Although we take what we believe to be reasonable steps to protect our intellectual property, including the use of agreements relating to the non-disclosure of our confidential and proprietary information and trade secrets to third parties, as well as agreements that provide for disclosure and assignment to us of all rights to the ideas, developments, improvements, discoveries and inventions of our employees, consultants, advisors and research collaborators while we employ them, such agreements can be difficult and costly to enforce.&#160; We generally seek to enter into these types of agreements with consultants, advisors and research collaborators; however, to the extent that such parties apply or independently develop intellectual property in connection with any of our projects, disputes may arise concerning allocation of the related proprietary rights.&#160; Such disputes often involve significant expense and yield unpredictable results.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Moreover, although all employees enter into agreements with us that include non-compete covenants, and our five senior executive officers have agreements that include broader non-competition covenants and provide for severance payments that are contingent upon the applicable employee&#8217;s refraining from competition with us, such non-compete provisions can be difficult and costly to monitor and enforce, such that, if any should resign, we may not be successful in enforcing our noncompetition agreements with them.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Despite the protective measures we employ, we still face the risk that:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="CFF9A1FBBF9440E8AC5105784CE907A9" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#8226;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	agreements may be breached;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="62F942BFF17B4A65B065FB4C9E1539DB" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#8226;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	agreements may not provide adequate remedies for the applicable type of breach;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="3E26DEFBB8B442948776D50D6AE63856" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#8226;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	our trade secrets or proprietary know-how may otherwise become known;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="DEA580883272498AA79A11FB479064FD" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>

	our competitors may independently develop similar technology; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="5AC198911B224DA2BA72D5D6CBE3391A" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#8226;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	our competitors may independently discover our proprietary information and trade secrets.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We depend upon key employees and consultants in a competitive market for skilled personnel.&#160; If we or our strategic partners or collaborators are unable to attract and retain key personnel, it could adversely affect our ability to develop and market our products.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Over the past few years, we implemented a plan to hire additional qualified personnel to support the advancement of AEROSURF development, as well as our other KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant products under development programs.&#160; In particular, we enhanced our clinical operations, regulatory affairs, quality control and assurance and administrative capabilities.&#160; We have competed and will continue to compete for qualified individuals with numerous biopharmaceutical companies, universities and other research institutions.&#160; Competition for such individuals is significant and attracting and retaining qualified personnel will be critical to our success, and any failure to do so successfully may have a material adverse effect on us.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We are highly dependent upon the members of our executive management team and our directors, as well as our scientific advisory board members, consultants and collaborating scientists.&#160; Many of these individuals have been involved with us for many years, have played integral roles in our progress and we believe that they continue to provide value to us.&#160; A loss of any of our key personnel may have a material adverse effect on aspects of our business and clinical development and regulatory programs.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">

</FONT>

<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We have entered into employment agreements with&#160;five executive officers, including, in February 2016, our President and Chief Executive Officer; in March 2013, the Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary; and the Senior Vice President, Human Resources; in March 2014, the Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer; and in December 2014, the Senior Vice President and Chief Development Officer.&#160; The agreements of executive officers other than that of our President and Chief Executive Officer will expire on March 31, 2017.&#160; In addition, we have agreements with three other officers that if not renewed will expire on March 31, 2017.&#160; The loss of services from any of our executives could significantly adversely affect our ability to develop and market our products and obtain necessary regulatory approvals.&#160; Further, we do not maintain key man life insurance.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	As we conduct our AEROSURF phase 2 clinical program, and prepare to conduct a phase 3 clinical trial, we will need to attract and retain highly-qualified personnel to join our management, medical, development and operations teams, although there can be no assurances that we will be successful in that endeavor.&#160; We may be unable to attract and retain necessary executive talent
</FONT>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our future success also will depend in part on the continued service of our key professional, scientific and management personnel and our ability to recruit and retain additional personnel.&#160; While we attempt to provide competitive compensation packages to attract and retain key personnel at all levels in our organization, many of our competitors have greater resources and more experience than we do, making it difficult for us to compete successfully for key personnel.&#160; We may experience intense competition for qualified personnel and the existence of non-competition agreements between prospective employees and their former employers may prevent us from hiring those individuals or subject us to lawsuits brought by their former employers.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our industry is highly competitive and we have less capital and resources than many of our competitors, which may give them an advantage in developing and marketing products similar to ours or make our products obsolete.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our industry is highly competitive and subject to rapid technological innovation and evolving industry standards.&#160; We compete with numerous existing companies in many ways.&#160; We need to successfully introduce new products to achieve our strategic business objectives.&#160; The development and acquisition of innovative products and technologies that improve efficacy, safety, patients&#8217; and clinicians&#8217; ease of use and cost-effectiveness involve significant technical and business risks.&#160; The success of new product offerings will depend on many factors, including our ability to properly anticipate and satisfy customer needs, adapt to new technologies, obtain regulatory approvals on a timely basis, demonstrate satisfactory clinical results, manufacture products in an economic and timely manner, and differentiate our products from those of our competitors.&#160; If we cannot successfully introduce new products, adapt to changing technologies or anticipate changes in our current and potential customers&#8217; requirements, our products may become obsolete and our business could suffer.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We intend to market our products under development for the treatment of diseases for which other technologies and treatments are rapidly developing and, consequently, we expect new companies to enter our industry and that competition in the industry will increase.&#160; Many of these companies have substantially greater research and development, manufacturing, marketing, financial, and technology personnel and managerial resources than we have.&#160; In addition, many of these competitors, either alone or with their collaborative partners, have significantly greater experience than we do in:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="6B541C401BAB42E9931B5A85A882A0A1" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#8226;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	developing products;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="329F53CB993A4AC7909AF5AD02B93B82" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#8226;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	undertaking preclinical testing and human clinical trials;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="2126591AC7F64576912D626154D0D882" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#8226;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	obtaining FDA and other regulatory approvals or products; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="564F37E326364A078E9278E78A5B3814" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#8226;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	manufacturing and marketing products.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Accordingly, our competitors may succeed in receiving FDA or foreign regulatory approval or commercializing products and obtaining patent protection before us.&#160; Our competitors may successfully secure regulatory exclusivities in various markets, which could have the effect of barring us or limiting our ability to market our products in such markets.&#160; For the sale of commercial products, we will compete against companies with greater marketing and manufacturing capabilities that may successfully develop and commercialize products that are more effective or less expensive than our products.&#160; In addition, developments by our competitors may render our drug product candidates obsolete or noncompetitive.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	52
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage60"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10KA_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We also face, and will continue to face, competition from colleges, universities, governmental agencies and other public and private research organizations.&#160; These competitive forces frequently and aggressively seek patent protection and licensing arrangements to collect royalties for technologies that they develop.&#160; Some of these technologies may compete directly with the technologies that we are developing.&#160; These institutions will also compete with us in recruiting highly qualified scientific personnel.&#160; We expect that therapeutic developments in the areas in which we are active may occur at a rapid rate and that competition will intensify as advances in this field are made.&#160; As a result, we need to continue to devote substantial resources and efforts to research and development activities.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The market price of our stock may be adversely affected by market volatility.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The market price of our common stock, like that of many other development stage pharmaceutical or biotechnology companies, has been and is likely to be volatile.&#160; In addition to general economic, political and market conditions, the price and trading volume of our stock could fluctuate widely in response to many factors, including:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

	&#160;

<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our common stock is listed for quotation on The Nasdaq Capital Market
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	.&#160; During the 12-month period ended December 31, 2015, the price of our common stock ranged between $2.69 and $25.48.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	We expect the price of our common stock to remain volatile.&#160; The average daily trading volume in our common stock varies significantly.&#160; For the twelve month period ended December 31, 2015, the average daily trading volume in our common stock was approximately 41,481 shares, and the average number of transactions per day was approximately 953.&#160; The instability observed in our daily volume and number of transactions per day may affect the ability of our stockholders to sell their shares in the public market at prevailing prices.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In the past, following periods of volatility in the market price of the securities of companies in our industry, securities class action litigation has often been instituted against companies in our industry.&#160; Even if securities class actions that may be filed against us in the future were ultimately determined to be meritless or unsuccessful, they would involve substantial costs and a diversion of management attention and resources, which could negatively affect our business.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>

	53
</FONT>

</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage61"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Future sales and issuances of our common stock or rights to purchase our common stock, including pursuant to our ATM Program, stock incentive plans and upon the exercise of outstanding securities exercisable for shares of our common stock, could result in substantial additional dilution of our stockholders, cause our stock price to fall and adversely affect our ability to raise capital.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We will require additional capital to continue to execute our business plan and advance our research and development efforts.&#160; To the extent that we raise additional capital through the issuance of additional equity securities and through the exercise of outstanding warrants, our stockholders may experience substantial dilution.&#160; We may sell shares of our common stock in one or more transactions at prices that may be at a discount to the then-current market value of our common stock and on such other terms and conditions as we may determine from time to time.&#160; Any such transaction could result in substantial dilution of our existing stockholders.&#160; If we sell shares of our common stock in more than one transaction, stockholders who purchase our common stock may be materially diluted by subsequent sales.&#160; Such sales could also cause a drop in the market price of our common stock.&#160; The issuance of shares of our common stock in connection with a public financing, under the ATM Program, in connection with our compensation programs, and upon exercise of outstanding warrants will have a dilutive impact on our other stockholders and the issuance, or even potential issuance, of such shares could have a negative effect on the market price of our common stock.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We filed a universal shelf registration statement with the SEC on Form S-3 (File No. 333-196420) on May 30, 2014 (which was declared effective on June 13, 2014) for the proposed offering from time to time of up to $250 million of our securities, including common stock, preferred stock, varying forms of debt and warrant securities, or any combination of the foregoing.&#160; We may issue securities pursuant to this shelf registration statement in the future in response to market conditions or other circumstances on terms and conditions that will be determined at such time.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	As of March 15, 2016, there were 8,191,289 shares of common stock issued and outstanding.&#160; In addition, as of December 31, 2015, approximately (i) 8.5 million shares of our common stock were reserved for potential issuance upon the exercise of outstanding warrants, (ii) 0.9 million shares of our common stock were reserved for issuance pursuant to our equity incentive plans, and (iii) 4,567 shares of our common stock were reserved for issuance pursuant to our 401(k) Plan.&#160; The exercise of stock options and other securities could cause our stockholders to experience substantial dilution.&#160; Moreover, holders of our stock options and warrants are likely to exercise them, if ever, at a time when we otherwise could obtain a price for the sale of our securities that is higher than the exercise price per security of the options or warrants.&#160; Such exercises, or the possibility of such exercises, may impede our efforts to obtain additional financing through the sale of additional securities or make such financing more costly.&#160; It may also reduce the price of our common stock.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	The failure to prevail in litigation or the costs of litigation, including securities class actions, product liability claims and patent infringement claims, could harm our financial performance and business operations
</FONT>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We are potentially susceptible to litigation.&#160; For example, as a public company, we may be subject to claims&#160; such actions, which generally seek unquantifiable damages and attorneys&#8217; fees and expenses, is uncertain.&#160; There can be no assurance that an adverse result in any future proceeding would not have a potentially material adverse effect on our business, results of operations and financial condition.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our business activities, including development, manufacture and marketing of our drug products and medical devices also exposes us to liability risks.&#160; Using our drug product candidates or medical devices, including in clinical trials, may expose us to product liability claims.&#160; Even if approved, our products may be subject to claims resulting from unintended effects that result in injury or death.&#160;&#160; Product liability claims alleging inadequate disclosure and warnings in our package inserts and medical device disclosures also may arise.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	54
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage62"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10KA_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Product liability claims may be brought by individuals or by groups seeking to represent a class.&#160; The outcome of litigation, particularly class action lawsuits, is difficult to assess or quantify.&#160; Plaintiffs in these types of lawsuits often seek recovery of very large or indeterminate amounts, and the magnitude of the potential loss relating to such lawsuits may remain unknown for substantial periods of time.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We presently carry general liability, excess liability, products liability and property insurance coverage in amounts that are customary for companies in our industry of comparable size and level of activity.&#160; However, our insurance policies contain various deductibles, limitations and exclusions from coverage, and in any event might not fully cover any potential claims.&#160; There can be no assurance that the insurance coverage we maintain is sufficient or will be available in adequate amounts or at a reasonable cost.&#160; A successful claim brought against us in excess of available insurance or not covered by indemnification agreements, or any claim that results in significant adverse publicity against us, could have an adverse effect on our business and our reputation.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We may need to obtain additional product liability insurance coverage, including with locally-authorized insurers licensed in countries where we conduct our clinical trials, before initiating clinical trials; however, such insurance is expensive and may not be available when we need it.&#160; In the future, we may not be able to obtain adequate insurance, with acceptable limits and retentions, at an acceptable cost.&#160; Any product, general liability or product liability claim, even if such claim is within the limits of our insurance coverage or meritless and/or unsuccessful, could adversely affect the availability or cost of insurance generally and our cash available for other purposes, such as research and development.&#160; In addition, such claims could result in:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="7B25E0B4A4FF48DE8E426BF357E63EDA" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#8226;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	uninsured expenses related to defense or payment of substantial monetary awards to claimants;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="40CE9DD44BBF4C8DB9DA38CD2AEFAEFE" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#8226;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	a decrease in demand for our drug product candidates;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="D88169D276B54169BE2429ADF432D1ED" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#8226;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	damage to our reputation; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="ECF4C963EB124ADCA08FE1D30D59FD85" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#8226;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	an inability to complete clinical trial programs or to commercialize our drug product candidates, if approved.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Moreover, the existence of a product liability claim could affect the market price of our common stock.&#160; In addition, as the USPTO keeps U.S. patent applications confidential in certain cases while the applications are pending, we cannot ensure that our products or methods do not infringe upon the patents or other intellectual property rights of third parties.&#160; As the biotechnology and pharmaceutical industries expand and more patents are applied for and issued, the risk increases that our patents or patent applications for our KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant product candidates or our medical device and combination drug/device products may give rise to a declaration of interference by the USPTO, or to administrative proceedings in foreign patent offices, or that our activities lead to claims of patent infringement by other companies, institutions or individuals.&#160; These entities or persons could bring legal proceedings against us seeking to invalidate our patents, obtain substantial damages or enjoin us from conducting research and development activities.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Provisions of our Certificate of Incorporation, our Amended and Restated By-Laws (By-Laws) and Delaware law could defer a change of our management and thereby discourage or delay offers to acquire us.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Provisions of our Certificate of Incorporation, our By-Laws and Delaware law may make it more difficult for someone to acquire control of us or for our stockholders to remove existing management, and might discourage a third-party from offering to acquire us, even if a change in control or in management would be beneficial to our stockholders.&#160; For example, our Certificate of Incorporation allows us to issue shares of preferred stock without any vote or further action by our stockholders.&#160; Our Board of Directors has the authority to fix and determine the relative rights and preferences of preferred stock.&#160; As a result, our Board of Directors could issue large blocks of preferred stock or authorize the issuance of a series of preferred stock that would grant to holders the preferred right to our assets upon liquidation, the right to receive dividend payments before dividends are distributed to the holders of common stock and the right to the redemption of the shares, together with a premium, before the redemption of our common stock.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	55
</FONT>

<A NAME="FIS_PROPERTIES"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="EFB1D2EECEF14819BAE8A0472E20EF1D" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	ITEM 2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	PROPERTIES.
</TD>
</TR>

</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	We maintain our principal executive offices at 2600 Kelly Road, Suite 100, Warrington, Pennsylvania 18976-3622, which consist of 39,594 square feet of space that we lease.&#160; In January 2013, we amended the lease
</FONT>
	(Amendment) to extend the term for an additional five years until February 2018; reduce the balance of a security deposit we maintain for the benefit of the landlord over a two year period beginning in 2013, from $400,000 to $225,000; reduce the base rent effective as of October 1, 2012; eliminate our obligation to remove certain improvements and restore the premises upon expiration of the lease; and adjust our option to extend the lease to an additional period of five years through February 2023.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	We do not own any real property
</FONT>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We also maintain at our Warrington location our analytical and technical support laboratory that is involved predominantly in release testing of all active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs), and supporting our research and development work for our lyophilized and aerosolized KL
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	4
</FONT>
	surfactant dosage forms as well as efforts to identify and protect our intellectual property.&#160; We also maintain a controlled medical device development laboratory that is used by our development engineering team to conduct preclinical development activities for AEROSURF
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	and our aerosol delivery technologies.&#160; Having our own device development laboratory allows us to conduct a range of research activities while at the same time controlling the related expense and conserving our financial resources.
</DIV>

	(Nasdaq) under the symbol &#8220;DSCO.&#8221;&#160; As of March 15, 2016, we had 104 holders of record of shares of our common stock.&#160; As of March 15, 2016, there were 8,191,289 shares of our common stock issued and outstanding.

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Some of the information contained in this discussion and analysis or set forth elsewhere in this Annual Report on Form 10-K, including information with respect to our plans and strategy for our business and related financing activities, includes forward-looking statements that involve risks and uncertainties.&#160; You should review the &#8220;Forward Looking Statements&#8221; and &#8220;Risk Factors&#8221; sections of this Annual Report on Form 10-K for a discussion of important factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from the results described in or implied by the forward-looking statements contained in the following discussion and analysis or elsewhere in the Annual Report on Form 10-K.
</DIV>
